radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver is normal in echotexture without focal mass. There is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary duct dilation. The common bile duct measures 4.0 mm. There is normal hepatopetal flow within the main portal vein. Multiple small gallstones and gravel are identified layering within the gallbladder. There is no gallbladder wall edema or pericholecystic fluid. The pancreas is not evaluated due to overlying bowel gas. There is no ascites seen within the abdomen.
